channel.title: Photo of the Day
channel.description: Photo of the Day - Made with love by RSSHub(https://github.com/DIYgod/RSSHub)

item.title: Holy Lights
item.description:
In this picture from the March 1966 issue, a woman lights a candle in a Russian Orthodox church in Moscow. At the time, atheism was state-mandated, and membership to a religious organization could disqualify you from jobs.
在这张1966年3月发行的照片中，一位妇女在莫斯科的俄罗斯东正教教堂点燃蜡烛。当时，无神论是国家规定的，加入一个宗教组织可能会取消你的工作资格。
item.author: Dean Conger, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Snowy Square
item.description:
Women walk through the snow to St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow, Russia. One of the most iconic symbols of Russia, construction for the cathedral began in 1555 under Ivan the Terrible.
俄罗斯，莫斯科，女人们穿过雪地走向圣巴兹尔大教堂。大教堂是俄罗斯最具标志性的标志之一，始建于1555年恐怖伊万的统治下。
item.author: Sisse Brimberg, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Getting the Shot
item.description:
Photographer Des Bartlett photographs snow and blue geese from the back of a station wagon in the Arizona desert. For the December 1973 issue, Bartlett and his wife Jen studied geese as they flew from the Canadian subarctic to the Gulf of Mexico.
摄影师德斯巴特利特在亚利桑那沙漠拍摄旅行车后座上的雪和蓝鹅。在1973年12月的一期中，巴特利特和他的妻子詹研究了从加拿大亚北极地区飞往墨西哥湾的鹅。
item.author: Des and Jen Bartlett, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Toys and Touch
item.description:
In this picture from the September 1949 issue, visually impaired boys at the Minnesota Braille and Sight Saving School arrange a toy farm in an exercise to improve their sense of touch.
在这张1949年9月发行的照片中，明尼苏达州盲文和视力拯救学校的视障男孩安排了一个玩具农场来锻炼他们的触觉。
item.author: B. Anthony Stewart and Jack E. Fletcher, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Steaming Seas
item.description:
Steaming volcanic rock in the South Sandwich Islands sets the dramatic background for a 65-foot yacht by the name Golden Fleece. The islands are so remote that it took this crew six days to reach them after leaving the southernmost tip of South America.
南桑威奇群岛热气腾腾的火山岩为一艘名为“金羊毛”的65英尺长游艇提供了戏剧性的背景。这些岛屿非常偏远，船员离开南美洲最南端后花了六天时间才抵达。
item.author: Maria Stenzel, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Your Move
item.description:
Mongolian children play chess in this image from the March 1962 issue. Red patches on their sleeves indicate the children's affiliation with the Young Pioneers, an organization run by the Communist Party.
这张图片来自1962年3月发行的《蒙古族儿童下棋》。他们袖子上的红色补丁表明孩子们与少先队（一个由共产党管理的组织）有联系。
item.author: Dean Conger, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: New Year Offering
item.description:
In Laos, the new year is celebrated in mid-April. In this photo from the April 2010 special issue on water, a woman sets a fiery offering on the Mekong River, known to Laotians as "the mother of waters."
在老挝，新年是在四月中旬庆祝的。这张照片来自2010年4月的《水》特刊，一位妇女在湄公河上献祭，被老挝人称为“水之母”
item.author: John Stanmeyer, Nat Geo Image Collection
